# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `h_joint_disorders`
* Variable label: `History of arthritis, rheumatism or osteoarthritis`
* Variable description: `history of arthritis, rheumatism or osteoarthritis`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | NOT joint_disorders 
1        | joint_disorders

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `h_joint_disorders_age`
* Variable label: `Age first diagnosed joint disorder`
* Variable description: `The age first told had joint disorder diagnosis`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1, h_joint_disorders_age = BA18A - ybirth`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `BA18<ybirth into 991`
* `h_joint_disorders == 999 into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
Health20002011_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=Health20002011_w1$id)
Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders <- car::recode(Health20002011_w1$BA18, "NA = 999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(Health20002011_w1$id))
Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age[which(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age[which(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders == 1 & Health20002011_w1$BA18A > Health20002011_w1$ybirth)] <- Health20002011_w1$BA18A[which(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders == 1 & Health20002011_w1$BA18A > Health20002011_w1$ybirth)] - Health20002011_w1$ybirth[which(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders == 1 & Health20002011_w1$BA18A > Health20002011_w1$ybirth)]
Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age[which(Health20002011_w1$BA18A < Health20002011_w1$ybirth)] <- 991
Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age <- car::recode(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age, "NA = 999")

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `BA18 (w1) == 0 and BA18 (w2) == 0 into 0`
* `BA18 (w1) == 1 or BA18 (w2) == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w2 and h_joint_disorders_age missing in w1, h_joint_disorders_age (w2) = BA18A - ybirth`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w2 and h_joint_disorders_age no-missing in w1, h_joint_disorders_age (w2) = as in w1`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w2}

# We use the harmonized variable of wave 1 instead of the study-specific variable
Health20002011_w2 <- left_join(Health20002011_w2, Health20002011_ds_w1, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
Health20002011_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=Health20002011_w2$id)
Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(Health20002011_ds_w2$id))
Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders[which(Health20002011_w2$BA18 == 0 & (Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders != 1 | is.na(Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders)))] <- 0
Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders[which(Health20002011_w2$BA18 == 1 | ((!is.na(Health20002011_w2$BA18)) & Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(Health20002011_ds_w2$id))
Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders_age[which(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders==0)] <- 996
Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders_age[which(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders==1 & !is.na(Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age) & !Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age[which(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders==1 & !is.na(Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age) & !Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]
Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders_age[which(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders==1 & !Health20002011_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector & (is.na(Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age) | Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector))] <- Health20002011_w2$BA18A[which(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders==1 & !Health20002011_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector & (is.na(Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age) | Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector))] - Health20002011_w2$ybirth[which(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders==1 & !Health20002011_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector & (is.na(Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age) | Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector))]
```

#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w2, echo=F, results='asis'}

AfterH <- table(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders)
X <- c(
  sum(Health20002011_w2$BA18 == 0 & (Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders != 1 | is.na(Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders)),na.rm = T),
  sum(((!is.na(Health20002011_w2$BA18)) & Health20002011_w2$BA18 == 1) | ((!is.na(Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(Health20002011_w2$BA18)) & Health20002011_w2$h_joint_disorders == 1))
)
BeforeH <- c(X[1:2],length(Health20002011_w2$id)-sum(X))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("all 0->0","some 1->1","NA->999")
kable(C)
```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.

**R script:**

```{r summ}
Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders <- labelled(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders, labels = cat_label)
label(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders) <- ds_label
Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age <- labelled(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age, labels = cont_label)
label(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age) <- ds_label_age
Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders <- labelled(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders, labels = cat_label)
label(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders) <- ds_label
Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders_age <- labelled(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders_age, labels = cont_label)
label(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders_age) <- ds_label_age

Health20002011_m_ds_w1 <- Health20002011_ds_w1
Health20002011_m_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders <- car::recode(Health20002011_m_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders, "miss_values_vector=NA")
Health20002011_m_ds_w2 <- Health20002011_ds_w2
Health20002011_m_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders <- car::recode(Health20002011_m_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders, "miss_values_vector=NA")

tt <-    frq(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders)[[1]][,c(1:2,4)]
tt[4] <- frq(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", 
             length(Health20002011_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders), length(Health20002011_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders)
             )
names(tt)<-c("val", "label", "w1", "w2")
kable(tt)

dbb <- merge(Health20002011_m_ds_w1[,c("id","h_joint_disorders")], Health20002011_m_ds_w2[,c("id","h_joint_disorders")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w1",".w2"), all=T)
names(dbb) <- c("id", "w1", "w2")
v.dbb <- paste(dbb[,2],dbb[,3],sep="")
f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
kable(f.dbb[f.dbb[,3]>=0.3,])
```



# Quality estimation

We assume that if an individual answers it has joint disorders in one wave, it has for all the next waves. Individuals with discrepancies with respect to this criterium are specified at the end of each validation.
